mcp.title: Docker MCP Server
mcp.description: Manage Docker containers, images, and services directly through Claude with comprehensive Docker API integration
mcp.author: JSONbored
mcp.content:
The Docker MCP Server provides Claude with complete Docker management capabilities. Features include:

## Core Capabilities

### Container Management
- List, start, stop, and restart containers
- Create containers from images with custom configurations
- Execute commands inside running containers
- Stream container logs in real-time
- Monitor container resource usage (CPU, memory, network)
- Manage container networks and volumes

### Image Operations
- Pull, build, and push Docker images
- List and inspect image details
- Tag and remove images
- Build images from Dockerfiles
- Multi-stage build support
- Image layer analysis and optimization

### Docker Compose Integration
- Manage multi-container applications
- Start, stop, and restart compose services
- Scale services up or down
- View service logs and status
- Update service configurations
- Handle environment-specific overrides

### Volume & Network Management
- Create, list, and remove volumes
- Mount volumes to containers
- Backup and restore volume data
- Create custom networks
- Connect containers to networks
- Inspect network configurations

### Registry Operations
- Push and pull from Docker registries
- Manage registry authentication
- Search for images in registries
- Handle private registry operations
- Image vulnerability scanning

## Installation

```bash
npm install @docker/mcp-server
```

## Configuration

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "docker": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@docker/mcp-server"],
      "env": {
        "DOCKER_HOST": "unix:///var/run/docker.sock",
        "DOCKER_API_VERSION": "1.43"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## Environment Variables

```bash
# Docker daemon connection
DOCKER_HOST=unix:///var/run/docker.sock
# For remote Docker
DOCKER_HOST=tcp://remote-docker:2376
DOCKER_TLS_VERIFY=1
DOCKER_CERT_PATH=/path/to/certs

# API version
DOCKER_API_VERSION=1.43

# Registry credentials
DOCKER_REGISTRY_USER=myuser
DOCKER_REGISTRY_PASSWORD=mypass
```

## Security Features
- Secure Docker daemon communication
- TLS certificate validation
- Registry authentication management
- Container security scanning
- Resource limit enforcement
- Network isolation controls

## Usage Examples

### Container Operations
```bash
# Run a new container
docker run -d --name web-server -p 8080:80 nginx:latest

# Execute command in container
docker exec -it web-server bash

# View container logs
docker logs -f web-server
```

### Image Building
```dockerfile
# Multi-stage Dockerfile example
FROM node:18-alpine AS builder
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci --only=production

FROM node:18-alpine AS runtime
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=builder /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY . .
EXPOSE 3000
CMD ["npm", "start"]
```

### Docker Compose
```yaml
version: '3.8'
services:
  web:
    build: .
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    environment:
      - NODE_ENV=production
    depends_on:
      - db
  
  db:
    image: postgres:15
    environment:
      - POSTGRES_DB=myapp
      - POSTGRES_USER=user
      - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=pass
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data

volumes:
  postgres_data:
```

## Monitoring & Debugging
- Real-time container metrics
- Log aggregation and analysis
- Health check monitoring
- Performance profiling
- Resource usage alerts
- Container lifecycle events

## Advanced Features
- Docker Swarm service management
- Multi-architecture image building
- BuildKit advanced features
- Container scanning and compliance
- Automated cleanup and optimization
- Integration with CI/CD pipelines

mcp.title: Filesystem MCP Server
mcp.description: Provides secure file system operations allowing Claude to read, write, and manage files with proper permissions
mcp.author: anthropic
mcp.content:
The Filesystem MCP Server enables Claude to interact with your local file system securely.

## Features

### File Operations
- **Read Files**: Read text and binary files
- **Write Files**: Create and update files
- **Delete Files**: Remove files safely
- **Move/Rename**: Relocate or rename files
- **Copy Files**: Duplicate files and directories

### Directory Management
- **List Contents**: Browse directory structures
- **Create Directories**: Make new folders
- **Remove Directories**: Delete empty or full directories
- **Tree View**: Hierarchical directory listing

### Advanced Features
- **Glob Patterns**: Search files using wildcards
- **File Metadata**: Get size, permissions, timestamps
- **Symlinks**: Create and manage symbolic links
- **Watch Files**: Monitor file changes in real-time

## Installation

```bash
# Using npm
npm install -g @modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem

# Add to Claude Code
claude mcp add filesystem npx -y @modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem /path/to/allowed/directory
```

## Configuration

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "filesystem": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem", "/home/user/projects"],
      "env": {
        "FILESYSTEM_READ_ONLY": "false",
        "FILESYSTEM_HIDDEN_FILES": "true"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## Security Considerations

- Restrict access to specific directories
- Consider read-only mode for sensitive areas
- Use permission rules to control operations
- Audit file operations with hooks

## Usage Examples

```
# List files
> "Show me all Python files in the src directory"

# Read file
> "Read the contents of config.json"

# Create file
> "Create a new README.md with project documentation"

# Search files
> "Find all files containing 'TODO' comments"
```

mcp.title: PostgreSQL MCP Server
mcp.description: Connect Claude to PostgreSQL databases for direct query execution, schema management, and database operations
mcp.author: JSONbored
mcp.content:
The PostgreSQL MCP Server enables Claude to interact directly with PostgreSQL databases. Features include:

## Core Capabilities

### Database Connection
- Connect to local and remote PostgreSQL instances
- Support for connection pooling and SSL
- Multiple database connections simultaneously
- Connection string and environment variable configuration

### Query Execution
- Execute SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE queries
- Run complex queries with JOINs and subqueries
- Support for prepared statements and parameters
- Transaction management (BEGIN, COMMIT, ROLLBACK)
- Query result formatting and export

### Schema Management
- View database schemas and table structures
- Create, alter, and drop tables
- Manage indexes, constraints, and foreign keys
- Handle database migrations and versioning
- Generate ERD (Entity Relationship Diagrams)

### Data Analysis
- Generate data insights and statistics
- Create aggregation queries and reports
- Identify data quality issues
- Performance analysis and query optimization
- Data export in various formats (CSV, JSON, XML)

### Advanced Features
- Support for PostgreSQL-specific features (JSONB, arrays, CTEs)
- Full-text search capabilities
- Spatial data operations with PostGIS
- Time-series data analysis
- Custom function and procedure execution

## Installation

```bash
npm install @modelcontextprotocol/server-postgres
```

## Configuration

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "postgres": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@modelcontextprotocol/server-postgres"],
      "env": {
        "POSTGRES_CONNECTION_STRING": "postgresql://username:password@localhost:5432/database"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## Environment Variables

```bash
# Connection string format
POSTGRES_CONNECTION_STRING=postgresql://user:pass@host:port/db

# Or individual components
POSTGRES_HOST=localhost
POSTGRES_PORT=5432
POSTGRES_DATABASE=mydb
POSTGRES_USER=myuser
POSTGRES_PASSWORD=mypass
POSTGRES_SSL=require
```

## Security Features
- SSL/TLS encryption support
- Read-only mode for safe data exploration
- Query whitelisting and blacklisting
- Connection timeout and rate limiting
- Audit logging for all database operations

## Usage Examples

### Data Analysis
```sql
-- Analyze customer behavior
SELECT 
  date_trunc('month', created_at) as month,
  COUNT(*) as new_customers,
  AVG(order_value) as avg_order_value
FROM customers 
WHERE created_at >= '2024-01-01'
GROUP BY month
ORDER BY month;
```

### Schema Exploration
```sql
-- Get table information
SELECT 
  table_name,
  column_name,
  data_type,
  is_nullable
FROM information_schema.columns 
WHERE table_schema = 'public'
ORDER BY table_name, ordinal_position;
```

mcp.title: Slack Integration MCP
mcp.description: Connect Claude to Slack for team communication, channel management, and workflow automation
mcp.author: claudepro
mcp.content:
The Slack Integration MCP Server enables Claude to interact with Slack workspaces for seamless team collaboration and workflow automation.

## Core Capabilities

### Messaging & Communication
- Send messages to channels and direct messages
- Read channel history and conversations
- React to messages with emojis
- Pin important messages
- Schedule messages for later delivery
- Create and manage message threads

### Channel Management
- Create public and private channels
- Archive and unarchive channels
- Invite and remove users from channels
- Set channel topics and purposes
- Manage channel permissions

### User & Workspace Management
- Get user profiles and presence status
- List workspace members
- Manage user groups and permissions
- Set user status and away messages

### File & Content Sharing
- Upload files and images to channels
- Share snippets and code blocks
- Create and share workflow automations
- Generate channel summaries and reports

### Workflow Automation
- Set up automated responses and triggers
- Create custom slash commands
- Integrate with external services
- Monitor channel activity and generate insights

## Installation

```bash
npm install @claudepro/mcp-slack
```

## Configuration

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "slack": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["@claudepro/mcp-slack"],
      "env": {
        "SLACK_BOT_TOKEN": "xoxb-your-bot-token",
        "SLACK_APP_TOKEN": "xapp-your-app-token",
        "SLACK_SIGNING_SECRET": "your-signing-secret"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## Setup Instructions

1. **Create Slack App**
   - Go to https://api.slack.com/apps
   - Click "Create New App" â†’ "From scratch"
   - Name your app and select workspace

2. **Configure OAuth Scopes**
   ```
   Bot Token Scopes:
   - channels:read
   - channels:write
   - chat:write
   - files:write
   - users:read
   - groups:read
   - im:read
   - mpim:read
   - reactions:write
   ```

3. **Install App to Workspace**
   - Go to "Install App" in sidebar
   - Click "Install to Workspace"
   - Copy the Bot User OAuth Token

4. **Enable Socket Mode (Optional)**
   - Go to "Socket Mode" and enable it
   - Generate App-Level Token with `connections:write` scope

## Usage Examples

### Send a Message
```javascript
// Send to channel
const result = await slack.sendMessage({
  channel: '#general',
  text: 'Hello team! ðŸ‘‹',
  blocks: [
    {
      type: 'section',
      text: {
        type: 'mrkdwn',
        text: '*Project Update*\nAll tests are passing! âœ…'
      }
    }
  ]
});
```

### Create Channel
```javascript
// Create private channel
const channel = await slack.createChannel({
  name: 'project-alpha',
  is_private: true,
  topic: 'Discussion for Project Alpha development'
});
```

### Upload File
```javascript
// Upload file with context
const upload = await slack.uploadFile({
  channels: '#development',
  file: './deployment-logs.txt',
  title: 'Deployment Logs',
  initial_comment: 'Latest deployment results from staging environment'
});
```

### Get Channel History
```javascript
// Get recent messages
const history = await slack.getChannelHistory({
  channel: '#general',
  limit: 50,
  include_all_metadata: true
});
```

## Advanced Features

### Interactive Components
- Create buttons and select menus
- Handle user interactions and callbacks
- Build modal dialogs and forms
- Implement approval workflows

### Scheduled Operations
- Daily standup reminders
- Weekly team reports
- Automated status updates
- Meeting notifications

### Integration Patterns
- GitHub notifications to Slack
- CI/CD pipeline updates
- Error monitoring alerts
- Customer support ticketing

### Analytics & Reporting
- Message frequency analysis
- User engagement metrics
- Channel activity reports
- Thread participation tracking
